Roasted Tomato Salsa

1 to 2 fresh jalapeÃ±o chiles
3 garlic cloves,
unpeeled 1 15-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice (fire roasted)
1/4 cup (loosely packed) chopped fresh cilantro
2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
Salt

Roast the chiles and garlic: 
1) In a small ungreased skillet over medium heat roast the chiles and garlic, 
until they are soft and blotchy brown(about 10 minutes for chiles, 15 minutes for garlic). 
2) Cool until handleable, then pull the stem(s) off the chile(s) and roughly chop. 
Peel the skin off the garlic. Scoop into a food processor and pulse until quite finely chopped.
Finish the salsa: 
Add the tomatoes with their juice.Re-cover and pulse until you have a coarse puree. 
Scrape into a serving dish.Stir in the cilantro and lime juice.
Taste and season with salt, usually about 1/2 teaspoon.
Bathue ka Raitha

Curd - 1 Cup
Bathua - 1/2 cup (boiled and mashed)
roasted Cumin powder - 1 Tea Spoon 
Salt - to taste
Red chili powder - to taste

1. Stir the curd with hand mixer
2. Add bathua paste and mix well.
3. Now add salt, cumin powder and chili powder, mix well.
4. Keep in refrigerator for an hour .
5. Serve chilled bathue raita with rice, parathas etc
Cucumber Raitha

2 cucumbers (kheera)
Â½ tsp. red chilli powder
1 tsp. salt
2. green chillies chopped
3 cups curd
1 tsp.cumin seeds powder
Â½ tsp. mustard powder
1 onion chopped

1.Whisk curd well and pour in a big bowl.
2.Cut cucumbers from the top and rub the cut off end with salt in order to remove its bitterness.
3.Wash clean and chop it into pieces. Dip these pieces in curd.
4.Add onion, red chilli powder, salt, mustard powder, green chill and jeera. Mix well together.
5.Cool in refrigerator and serve cold.
Mango Raitha

Mustard seeds - 1/4 Tea Spoon
Red Chilli flakes - 1
Curd - 1 cup
Sugar - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Ripe Mangoes - 2
Onion - 1 Table Spoon (Chopped)
Salt - to taste
Oil - 1 Tea Spoon
Green Chill - 1 (finely chop)
fresh Coconut - 1 tbsp (Grated)
Mustard Powder - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Peel the outer skin of the mangoes and slice them in small cubes.
2. Add the mustard powder, green chillies, fresh coconut, sugar and salt to the curd
3. Whisk together and add to the mango cubes and stir well
4. Heat oil in the pan.
5. When hot add the mustard seeds.
6. When seeds begins splutter , add the red chilli and onion and saute
7. Let the onion turn golden brown.
8. Turn off the flame and add to the curd mixture.
9. Mix well and serve at room temperature or cold.
10. Garnish with cut coriander leaves.
11. Prepare in advance to let all flavors mix together.
Garlic Chutney

Garlic - 4 pods
Red chillies - 20 ( roasted )
Grated coconut - 2 cups
Oil - 4 Tea Spoon
Tamarind - a little
Salt - To Taste

1. Take a Kadai and heat oil in it.
2. sautÃ© the garlic and coconut in the oil.
3. Make tamarind pulp by soaking tamarind in some water for 2 hours and then strain
4. Then grind the saute mixture with roasted red chillies and tamarind pulp.
5. Add the garlic and salt and grind once again to a smooth paste
6. Now the tasty garlic chutney is ready to serve.
Pomegranate Raitha

Yogurt - 2 cups
Pomegranate - 1/2 cup
Black salt - Pinch
Black pepper - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Green chilies - 2 (finely chopped)
Coriander leaves - 1/2 Tea Spoon (finely chopped)
Ground sugar - 1 Tea Spoon
Cumin seed powder - Â¼ Tea Spoon

1. Take a mixing bowl and whisk the curd in it l with a hand blender.
2. Add salt, pepper and ground sugar.
3. Add pomegranate, green chili and coriander leaves.
4. Mix it well by using the serving spoon and chill it.
5. Garnish it coriander leaves and cumin powder and serve
Apricot Chutney

Apricots - 360 Grams
Vinegar - 1 cup
Water - 2 cups
Salt - 2 Tea Spoon
Red chili powder - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Cardamom - 2 (crushed)
Sugar - 2 tea-spoons
ginger - long strips
garlic - 1 clove ( chopped )
raisins - 4 tea-spoons
almonds - 8 blanched

1. Put apricots in boiling water till soft..
2. Peel and mash the apricots
3. Strain the pulp and wash the stones of apricots with one cup of water.
4. Cook apricot pulp, ginger, garlic and water of washed stones, almonds and raisins till all the water is absorbed.
5. Add vinegar, sugar, salt, cardamoms and red chili pepper and cook till is thick and golden brown
6. Put it in jar. This can be kept for one year..
Corn Raitha

Cauliflower - Â¼ CUP
Green peas - Â¼ CUP
Boiled potatoes - 2
Onion - 1
Boiled sweet corn - Â½ CUP
Carrots - Â¼ CUP
French beans - Â¼ CUP
Strained curd - 1 CUP
Sugar and salt - as per taste
Green chilly - 2
Curry leaves - few
Mustard seeds - Â¼ Tea Spoon
Cooking oil - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Cut all the vegetables in big pieces and boil and strain them and keep aside.
2. Heat some oil in a pan and add mustard seeds curry leaves and green chilly in to it after it heats up add the strained curd in it and then add salt and sugar to taste.
3. Then add all the boiled vegetables into it.
4. Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves.
5. This can also beaten as a vegetable dish with chapatti and it is a low calorie healthy nutritious food

Coriander â 30gms (1Cup) Finely Chopped
Green Chilies â 4 Or To Taste (Break Them Into Small Pieces)
Grated Coconut â 2Tbsps
Roasted Bengal Gram â 1Tbsp
Salt â To Taste
Sugar â 1/2tsp
Lemon Juice â 2tsp

1.To a mixie jar add chopped coriander, green chilies, grated coconut, roasted bengal gram, salt, sugar and lemon juice.\n2.Grind the ingredients and add water (90ml) and grind to a smooth paste. Transfer the prepared coriander chutney to a serving bowl.
Capsicum Raitha

Curd - 2 cups
capsicum - 1/2 cup (cut into 1 inch cubes and remove the seeds)
mustard seed - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
dried red chili - 2
sugar - 1/2 Tea Spoon

1. Heat oil in a small frying pan, add mustard seed. add der and fry till it turns translucent.
2. When it starts to splutter; add broken red chillies and then add the chopped capsicum and fry till it becomes soft but is crunchy.
3. Beat the curd in a bowl and add sugar, salt and chili powder. Mix well.
4. Finally add fried capsicum and mix it well.
5. Serve it chill.
Onion Chutney

Onions - 2 (chopped)
Ginger - Â½â piece (chopped) 
Green chillies - 2 ( chopped)
Cumin seeds - 1 teaspoon
Red chillies - 1 ( broken into bits )
Oil - 2 tablespoons
lemon juice - To taste
Salt - to taste

1. Grind the onions, green chillies, and ginger to a fine paste without using any water. Pour the paste / chutney into a bowl.\n2. Heat the oil in a pan on medium level for about 2 minutes till it is hot enough. Add the cumin seeds. Let them splutter and then add the red chillies. Fry briefly and pour it on the chutney.\n3. Add salt and lemon juice to the chutney.
Peanut Chutney

Peanuts - Â½ cup
Garlic cloves - 3
Red chillis - 4
Tamarind pulp - 2 Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
Jaggery - 1 Tea Spoon (grated)
SEASONING / THADKA/ POPU:
Mustard seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Curry leaves - few

1. Dry roast the peanuts in a dry pan to golden color
2. Let it cool for some time and remove the outer skin of the peanuts by rubbing them in between your palms
3. Heat oil in a pan add seasoning to it and saute. When they turn to golden brown take the seasoning in to a bowl
4. Add red chillis and garlic cloves to the remaining oil and saute
5. Let them cool for some time and grind in a mixer jar.
6. Add the roasted peanuts to the grounded powder and grind in to coarse powder
7. Add grated Jaggery, tamarind pulp and salt to it and grind.
8. Add some water if needed
9. Take in to the serving bowl and add the seasoning to it
10. Serve with idlies, dosas or upma
Gajar Chutney

Carrots - 200 Grams
coconut - small piece
Coriander leaves - few (chopped)
green chillies - 4
lemon juice - 1 Tea Spoon
Salt - To Taste
grounded pepper - as per taste
FOR SEASONING/ THADKA / THALIMPU:
Black gram dal - Â½ Tea Spoon
Mustard seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Curry leaves - few

1. Clean and grate the carrots and keep in a bowl
2. Take a mixer jar and add coconut piece, green chillis, grounded pepper and salt and grind
3. Add grated carrot and grind once again in to smooth consisitency
4. Take in to the serving bowl and add lemon juice to it
5. Heat a pan and add little oil to it.
6. When the oil gets heated add blackgram dal, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and saute
7. When they starts splutter, add curry leaves and turn off the flame
8. Add the seasoning to the chutney and serve.
Besan Chutney

Besan - 1 cup
Water - 3 cups
Green chillis - 6 (Slit length wise)
Hing - a pinch
Salt - to taste

1. Make a batter with besan, salt and 2 cups of water, and keep it aside.
2. Fry mustard, hing, and green chillies in oil for a few minutes and then add 1 cup of water.
3. Let it cook for a few minutes.
4. Now add the besan batter and keep stirring until the besan gets cooked.
5. Take it in to serving bowl and serve with idlies or puris.
Raw Cumcumber chutney

Dosa kaya (Raw cucumber) - 1
Turmeric - Â¼ Tea Spoon
Red chillis - 4
Salt - to taste
Tamarind - small lemon size
Oil - 1 Table Spoon
Bengal gram - Â½ Tea Spoon
Mustard seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Curry leaves - few

1. Peel the layer of the cucumber and cut them into small pieces and keep them aside in a bowl.
2. Add turmeric to the pieces and mix.
3. Take a Kadai and put oil and heat it
4. Put mustard seeds ,cumin seeds ,Black gram and saute till they splutter
5. Then add Dry chilies and curry leaves to it and saute for a minute
6. Let it cool for some time and when it gets cooled grind the above ingredients in to powder by adding salt and tamarind to it
7. Add the grounded powder to the cucumber pieces and mix well
8. Then take in to the serving bowl and garnish with coriander leaves.
9. It goes very well with rice.
Pudina Chutney

Pudina - 2 bunches
Tamarind - small lemon sized
Oil - 3 Table Spoon
Salt - as per tast
Sesame powder - 1 Table Spoon
Black gram dal - Â½ Tea Spoon
Mustard seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ Tea Spoon
Red chillis - 3
Curry leaves - few

1. Heat the oil, add Pudina leaves, red chillis. Fry them and take them in to a bowl.
2. Grind the fried Pudina leaves along with tamarind, salt and sesame by adding little water (if needed).
3. Put oil in the Kadai and add mustard seeds, black gram dal, red chillis, cumin seeds .
4. When they start splutter add curry leaves and turmeric powder to it and stir for a moment.
5. Add the seasoning to the chutney.
6. Take in to the serving bowl and serve with rice.
